content.description: Two long, straight wires are parallel to each another and in the plane of the page. An electron is moving toward the right midway between the wires, as shown. Each wire carries current of the same <math alttext="i" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The current in the top wire is directed toward the right.
content.question: The current in the bottom wire is adjusted so that the magnetic field halfway between the wires points out of the page. Which of the following statements best describes the motion of the electron beam?

choices.label: The electron beam bends toward the top wire.
The electron beam bends out of the page.
The electron beam continues in a straight line.
The electron beam bends into the page.
The electron beam bends toward the bottom wire.

content.answer: The electron beam bends toward the top wire.
